Situation A. Durrell's Claim

Durrell's Claim

I used unit rep-tiles to show that the smaller right triangle is similar to the larger right triangle. Is he correct? Explain.

Durrell’s Claim is not correct.

Students may refer back to Problem 3.1 Kazuko’s Claim. The scale factor is not a whole number. So, we cannot consider the smaller triangle as a unit rep-tile. The distance from Stake 1 to Stake 2 in smaller triangle is 80 ft. The corresponding distance in larger triangle is 140 ft (from Tree 1 to Tree 2). If you put two small triangles, it will be 160 ft long, which is longer than 140 ft. You cannot fit whole amounts of the small triangles in the large triangle. Therefore, you cannot use rep-tiles to show the similarity.

Situation B. Alejandra Moves the Stakes

Alejandra's Strategy

I put the stakes in different places and made a sketch. It does not change my answer. Is she correct? Explain.

tiles.title: Another Diagram of the river with similar triangles

text: Yes, the distance will be the same. The scale factor from the small to the large triangle is 4. This gives the distance between Stake 3 and Tree 1 as 120 ft. From this, we subtract the 30 ft from Stake 3 to Stake 1 to get 90 ft across the river. In this case, you can use rep-tiles because you can fit 16 small triangles into the large triangle.

Situation C. Repeating the Experiment

Some students repeat the indirect measurement at a different part of the river. Their measurements at the new location vary slightly. They get different results for the width of the river. The measurements for the distance across the river are 100.5 feet, 99.5 feet, 98 feet, 99 feet, 101.5 feet, 102.5 and 100.5 feet.

To arrive at the final distance across the river, they decide to find the mean of the distances. Does this make sense? Explain.

Answers will vary.

Students might discuss that the mean “balances out” the errors. So as long as there are no outliers, it makes sense to use the mean.

Measures of center can help us gain a sense of the best estimate for a set of data.

Mean:

98 + 99 + 99.5 + 100.5 + 100.5 + 101.5 + 102.5 = 701.5

701.5 ÷ 7 = 100.2142857

Median: 98, 99, 99.5, 100.5, 100.5, 101.5, 102.5

Mode: 100.5

Indirect measures are estimates that can give us a reasonable estimate of actual measurements that are difficult or impossible to find.
